00054 static __inline__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00055     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00056     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00057             : "=r" (word)
00058             : "r"  (word));
00059     return word;
00060 }
00061 
00062 static inline unsigned long long arti_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00063                                               unsigned long uld,
00064                                               unsigned long *r) {
00065     /*
00066      * Fixed by Marco Morandini <morandini@aero.polimi.it> to work
00067      * with the -fnostrict-aliasing and -O2 combination using GCC
00068      * 3.x.
00069      */
00070 
00071     unsigned long long qf, rf;
00072     unsigned long tq, rh;
00073     union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00074 
00075     p.ull = ull;
00076     q.ull = 0;
00077     rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00078 
00079     while (p.ull >= uld) {
00080         q.ul[1] += (tq = p.ul[1] / uld);
00081         rh = p.ul[1] - tq * uld;
00082         q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[0] / uld);
00083         p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[0] - tq * uld);
00084     }
00085 
00086     *r = p.ull;
00087 
00088     return q.ull;
00089 }
00090 
00091 static inline int arti_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00092 
00093     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00094     
00095     int dummy;
00096 
00097     __asm__ __volatile__ ( \
00098         "mull %%edx\t\n" \
00099         "div %%ecx\t\n" \
00100         : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00101         : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00102 
00103     return i;
00104 }
00105 
00106 static inline long long arti_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00107 
00108     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00109 
00110     __asm__ __volatile ( \
00111         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00112         "mull %%esi\t\n" \
00113         "movl %%eax,%%ebx\n\t" \
00114         "movl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00115         "movl %%edx,%%ecx\t\n" \
00116         "mull %%esi\n\t" \
00117         "addl %%ecx,%%eax\t\n" \
00118         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00119         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00120         "movl %%eax,%%ecx\t\n" \
00121         "movl %%ebx,%%eax\t\n" \
00122         "divl %%edi\n\t" \
00123         "sal $1,%%edx\t\n" \
00124         "cmpl %%edx,%%edi\t\n" \
00125         "movl %%ecx,%%edx\n\t" \
00126         "jge 1f\t\n" \
00127         "addl $1,%%eax\t\n" \
00128         "adcl $0,%%edx\t\n" \
00129         "1:\t\n" \
00130         : "=A" (ll) \
00131         : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div) \
00132         : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00133 
00134     return ll;
00135 }

00201 static inline unsigned long long arti_rdtsc (void) {
00202     unsigned long long t;
00203     __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (t));
00204     return t;
00205 }

00256 /* arti_get_current() is Adeos-specific. Since real-time interrupt
00257    handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI domain stack, we cannot
00258    infere the "current" Linux task address using %esp. We must use the
00259    suspended Linux domain's stack pointer instead. */
00260 
00261 static inline struct task_struct *arti_get_current (int cpuid)
00262 
00263 {
00264     int *esp;
00265 
00266     __asm__ volatile("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r" (esp));
00267 
00268     if (esp >= arti_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < arti_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00269         return (struct task_struct *)(((u_long)adp_root->esp[cpuid]) & (~8191UL));
00270 
00271     return get_current();
00272 }

00277 static inline void rt_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00278 
00279     arti_cli();
00280     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00281 }
00282 
00283 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00284 
00285     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00286     arti_sti();
00287 }

00289 static inline unsigned long rt_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00290 
00291     unsigned long flags;
00292     arti_local_irq_save(flags);
00293     rt_spin_lock(lock);
00294     return flags;
00295 }

00297 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00298                                              spinlock_t *lock) {
00299     rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00300     arti_local_irq_restore(flags);
00301 }

00303 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00304 
00305 #define CPU_RELAX(x) \
00306 do { \
00307    int i = 0; \
00308    do \
00309      cpu_relax(); \
00310    while (++i < x); \
00311 } while(0)
00312 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00313 #define CPU_RELAX(x)
00314 
00315 void arti_broadcast_to_timers(int irq,
00316                               void *dev_id,
00317                               struct pt_regs *regs);
00318 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00320 static inline void rt_get_global_lock(void) {
00321 
00322     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00323 
00324     arti_cli();
00325 
00326     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00327         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock))
00328             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00329 }
00330 
00331 static inline void rt_release_global_lock(void) {
00332 
00333     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00334 
00335     arti_cli();
00336 
00337     if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock)) {
00338         clear_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock);
00339         CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00340     }
00341 }
00342 
00355 static inline void rt_global_cli(void) {
00356     rt_get_global_lock();
00357 }
00358 
00365 static inline void rt_global_sti(void) {
00366     rt_release_global_lock();
00367     arti_sti();
00368 }
00369 
00376 static inline int rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void) {
00377 
00378     unsigned long flags = arti_get_iflag_and_cli();
00379     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00380 
00381     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00382         {
00383         while (test_and_set_bit(31,&arti_cpu_lock))
00384             CPU_RELAX(cpuid);
00385 
00386         return flags | 1;
00387         }
00388 
00389     return flags;
00390 }
00391 
00399 static inline void rt_global_save_flags(unsigned long *flags) {
00400 
00401     unsigned long hflags = arti_get_iflag_and_cli(), rflags;
00402     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00403 
00404     if (test_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_lock))
00405         rflags = hflags;
00406     else
00407         rflags = hflags | 1;
00408 
00409     if (hflags)
00410         arti_sti();
00411 
00412     *flags = rflags;
00413 }
00414 
00422 static inline void rt_global_restore_flags(unsigned long flags) {
00423 
00424     switch (flags)
00425         {
00426         case (1 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 1:
00427 
00428             rt_release_global_lock();
00429             arti_sti();
00430             break;
00431 
00432         case (1 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 0:
00433 
00434             rt_get_global_lock();
00435             arti_sti();
00436             break;
00437 
00438         case (0 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 1:
00439 
00440             rt_release_global_lock();
00441             break;
00442 
00443         case (0 << ARTI_IFLAG) | 0:
00444 
00445             rt_get_global_lock();
00446             break;
00447         }
00448 }

00450 static inline void rt_switch_to_real_time(int cpuid) {
00451 
00452     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_RT(cpuid);
00453     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = arti_get_current(cpuid);
00454     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags = arti_linux_save_flags_and_cli();
00455     set_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_realtime);
00456 }
00457 
00458 static inline void rt_switch_to_linux(int cpuid) {
00459 
00460     TRACE_RTAI_SWITCHTO_LINUX(cpuid);
00461     clear_bit(cpuid,&arti_cpu_realtime);
00462     arti_linux_restore_flags(arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldflags);
00463     arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask = NULL;
00464 }
00465 
00466 static inline struct task_struct *rt_whoislinux(int cpuid) {
00467 
00468     return arti_linux_context[cpuid].oldtask;
00469 }

00471 static inline int rt_is_linux (void) {
00472 
00473     return !test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&arti_cpu_realtime);
00474 }
00475 
00476 static inline int rt_is_lxrt (void) {
00477 
00478     return test_bit(adeos_processor_id(),&arti_cpu_lxrt);
00479 }

00481 static inline void rt_set_timer_delay (int delay) {
00482 
00483     if (delay) {
00484         unsigned long flags;
00485         arti_hw_lock(flags);
00486 #ifdef __USE_APIC__
00487         apic_read(APIC_TMICT);
00488         apic_write(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00489 #else /* !__USE_APIC__ */
00490         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00491         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00492 #endif /* __USE_APIC__ */
00493         arti_hw_unlock(flags);
00494     }
00495 }
